required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating The Effects Of Neratinib After Adjuvant Trastuzumab In Women With Early Stage Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Trial Of Neratinib (HKI-272) After Trastuzumab In Women With Early-Stage HER-2/Neu Overexpressed/Amplified Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate whether neratinib can further reduce the risk of recurrence from previously diagnosed HER-2 positive breast cancer after adjuvant treatment with trastuzumab.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Invasive Disease-free Survival (iDFS) in Neratinib Arm Compared to Placebo Arm
primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until time of event up to 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Invasive disease-free survival time is defined as the time from date of randomization until the first disease recurrence of the following events: invasive ipsilateral breast tumor recurrence, invasive contralateral breast cancer, local/regional invasive recurrence, distant recurrence and death from any cause.

primary_outcome.measure: Kaplan-Meier Estimates of Invasive Disease-free Survival (iDFS) at Year 2 by Treatment Arms
primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until time of event up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of randomization to death
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from randomization to death from any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Disease-free Survival Including Ductal Carcinoma in Situ (DFS-DCIS) in Neratinib Arm Compared to Placebo Arm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until time of event up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Disease-free survival including DCIS time is defined as the time from date of randomization until the first occurrence of DCIS or an iDFS event (an iDFS event including invasive ipsilateral breast tumor recurrence, invasive contralateral breast cancer, local/regional invasive recurrence, or distant recurrence and death from any.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan-Meier Estimates of Disease-free Survival Including Ductal Carcinoma in Situ (DFS-DCIS) at Year 2 by Treatment Arms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until time of event up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Distant Disease-free Survival (DDFS) in Neratinib Arm Compared to Placebo Arm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until time of event up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Distant disease-free survival time is defined as the time from date of randomization until the first occurrence of distant recurrence or death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan-Meier Estimates of Distant Disease-free Survival (DDFS) at Year 2 by Treatment Arms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until time of event up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Distant Recurrence (TTDR) in Neratinib Arm Compared to Placebo Arm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until time of event up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time to distant recurrence is defined as the time from date of randomization until the first occurrence of distant recurrence or death from breast cancer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan-Meier Estimates of Time to Distant Recurrence (TTDR) Survival at Year 2 by Treatment Arms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until time of event up to 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Central Nervous System Recurrence in Neratinib Arm Compared to Placebo Arm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until time of event up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: CNS recurrence is defined as the time from randomization to CNS as the first distant recurrence. Competing events include distant recurrence at other sites as the first distant recurrence and death from any cause prior to distant recurrence.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Incidence of Central Nervous System Recurrence (CNS) at Year 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until time of event up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative incidence of Central Nervous System Recurrence (CNS) is estimated by Gray's method (Gray,1988).

arm_group.description: 240 mg orally daily for one year

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stage II through IIIC HER-2/erbB-2 positive breast cancer with node positive disease.
- Been treated for early breast cancer with standard of care duration of trastuzumab.
- Could have been treated neoadjuvantly but have not reached pathologic complete response.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Positive clinical and radiologic assessments for local or regional recurrence of disease at the time of study entry.
- History of heart disease.
- QTc interval >0.45 seconds
- History of gastrointestinal disease with diarrhea as the major symptom.

location_countries.country: Macedonia, The Former Yugoslav Republic of

group.title: Neratinib
group.description: Patients who completed prior adjuvant trastuzumab received six 40 mg neratinib tablets (240 mg) taken orally once daily with food, preferably in the morning, continuously for one year. Therapy continued until unacceptable toxicity, recurrent disease, death, or withdrawal of consent occurred.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients who completed prior adjuvant trastuzumab received six 40 mg placebo tablets (240 mg) taken orally once daily with food, preferably in the morning, continuously for one year.Therapy continued until unacceptable toxicity, recurrent disease, death, or withdrawal of consent occurred.

baseline.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population included all participants who were randomized regardless of whether they received any study treatment.

group.description: Patients who completed prior adjuvant trastuzumab received six 40 mg neratinib tablets (240 mg) taken orally once daily with food, preferably in the morning, continuously for one year. group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Invasive Disease-free Survival (iDFS) in Neratinib Arm Compared to Placebo Arm
outcome.description: Invasive disease-free survival time is defined as the time from date of randomization until the first disease recurrence of the following events: invasive ipsilateral breast tumor recurrence, invasive contralateral breast cancer, local/regional invasive recurrence, distant recurrence and death from any cause.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization until time of event up to 2 years
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population included all participants who were randomized regardless of whether they received any study treatment.

group.title: Neratinib
group.description: Patients who completed prior adjuvant trastuzumab received six 40 mg neratinib tablets (240 mg) taken orally once daily with food, preferably in the morning, continuously for one year. Therapy continued until unacceptable toxicity, recurrent disease, death, or withdrawal of consent occurred.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients who completed prior adjuvant trastuzumab received six 40 mg placebo tablets (240 mg) taken orally once daily with food, preferably in the morning, continuously for one year. Therapy continued until unacceptable toxicity, recurrent disease, death, or withdrawal of consent occurred.

measure.title: Invasive Disease-free Survival (iDFS) in Neratinib Arm Compared to Placebo Arm
measure.description: Invasive disease-free survival time is defined as the time from date of randomization until the first disease recurrence of the following events: invasive ipsilateral breast tumor recurrence, invasive contralateral breast cancer, local/regional invasive recurrence, distant recurrence and death from any cause.
measure.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population included all participants who were randomized regardless of whether they received any study treatment.

analysis.groups_desc: Invasive disease-free survival (iDFS) in neratinib arm compared to placebo arm.
analysis.method_desc: The Log-rank test is stratified by prior trastuzumab (concurrent or sequential), nodal status (<= 3 or >= 4) and ER/PgR status (positive or negative).
analysis.estimate_desc: The hazard ratio is estimated by stratified Cox model. The Cox model is stratified by prior trastuzumab (concurrent or sequential), nodal status (<= 3 or >= 4) and ER/PgR status (positive or negative).

outcome.title: Kaplan-Meier Estimates of Invasive Disease-free Survival (iDFS) at Year 2 by Treatment Arms
outcome.time_frame: From randomization until time of event up to 2 years
outcome.population: Intent to treat (ITT) population included all participants who were randomized regardless of whether they received any study treatment.

reported_events.time_frame: From first dose through 28 days after the last dose, up to two years.
reported_events.desc: The safety population included all participants who received at least one dose of investigational product.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
